physicalDescription.extent: The file is divided up into thematic sections as outlined in the scope and content.

The file is contained within a bound volume that contains a number of other files.Foliation: The foliation for this report commences at f 7, and terminates at f 11, as it is part of a larger physical volume; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 7-89; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and can be found in the bottom right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file is a report written by Sir Frederic Arthur Hirtzel of the Political Department of the India Office, regarding the Bagdad [Baghdad]-Basra railway scheme.The report asseses the political and commerical implications of the contruction of the Gulf section of the railway scheme and whether, and in partnership with whom, the British Government should participate in funding it. The report discusses neogtiations between the British and Turkish (Ottoman) Governments and the various proposals offered by either side.The file is divided up as follows:I. The present position;II. The objections to the last proposals made by His Majesty's Government;III. The view of the Board of Trade;IV. The importance of the river;V. Conclusions;VI. The practicability of obtaining 50 per cent;VII. The procedure to be adopted now;VIII. The alternative.
